attributes.imagesize: '''House Erenford''' is a knightly house of the Riverlands. They are sworn to House Frey of the Twins.==Known members==*Lady Joyeuse Erenford, the eighth wife of Lord Walder Frey,<ref>http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season1/#!/guide/houses/frey/ HBO viewers guide, season 1 guide to houses, House Frey entry</ref> killed by Catelyn Stark during the Red Wedding.==In the books==In the ''A Song of Ice and Fire'' novels, House Erenford is a lesser knightly house sworn to House Frey. Their sigil is a golden heron, beaked and gammed black, standing with a silver fish in its beak, on pink.==See also==* AWOIAF (spoilers from the books)==References==ReflistRiver HousesCategory:Vassal houses

'''House Erenford''' is a knightly house of [[the Riverlands]]. They are sworn to [[House Frey]] of [[the Twins]].
sections.Known members: *Lady {[[Joyeuse Erenford]]}, the eighth wife of Lord [[Walder Frey]],<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season1/#!/guide/houses/frey/ HBO viewers guide, season 1 guide to houses, House Frey entry]</ref> killed by [[Catelyn Stark]] during the [[Red Wedding]].
sections.In the books: In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, House Erenford is a lesser knightly house sworn to House Frey. Their sigil is a golden heron, beaked and gammed black, standing with a silver fish in its beak, on pink.
